answer: Penn State Harrisburg is located in Middletown, Pennsylvania near the Harrisburg International Airport.
For admissions, you can apply through the Penn State website or Common App. The Admissions Office is located in the Swatara Building. You can contact them at hbgadmit@psu.edu.
The Penn State Harrisburg Library offers books, journals, databases, study spaces, and research help. It is located in the library building centrally on campus.
The Academic Advisory building is located in the Olmsted Building's left wing, second floor. For other advisory purposes, students can request it online via email.
Information Technology Services (ITS) is located in the Olmsted Building basement (E110). They help with accounts, Wi-Fi, and software. You can contact the IT help desk by phone or email.
Student life includes clubs, organizations, and student government. Visit the Student Enrichment Center (SEC) 1st floor or browse the campus website for events.
The campus has a fitness center and various intramural sports. The Capital Union Building (CUB) houses the gym and athletic facilities.
Health and counseling resources (CAPS) are available in the Student Enrichment Center, 2nd floor. They offer mental health support and medical referrals.
Student Disability Resources (SDR) is located in the Student Enrichment Center, 2nd floor. They help arrange academic and housing accommodations.
Most students need a parking permit. Visit the Parking Office in the Maintenance and Operations Building or buy permits online.
Career Services is located in the Student Enrichment Center, 2nd floor. They help with internships, resumes, and job searches via Nittany Lion Careers.
You can grab food at 'Stacks Market' in the Olmsted Building or 'The Outpost' in the Student Enrichment Center. There is also a Starbucks available on campus.
On-campus housing is available at 'The Village'. It creates a neighborhood-style living experience. You can contact the Housing Office in the Community Center.
Tuition varies by residence and major. For questions about bills, scholarships, or FAFSA, visit the Bursar's Office or Financial Aid Office in the Swatara Building.
In an emergency, dial 911. For non-emergencies, University Police can be reached at 717-948-6232. Their office is located in the Susquehanna Building.
